assignment6monsters

Class Monster

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment6monsters.Monster
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Goblin, Manticore, OrcInfantry

    public class Monster
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the monster super class for the Assignment6 Monsters program. this is the top parent from which all the other game classes are extended to. keeps track of all the required variables for the child objects, as well as dynamic validation post object construction and throughout play. I, Sean Flannigan, student number 000270501, certify that all code submitted is my own work; that I have not copied it from any other source. I also certify that I have not allowed my work to be copied by others.

        public java.lang.String getClan()

        Returns:
        the clan String variable representing 1 of 3 clans

      • setClan

        public void setClan(java.lang.String clan)
        String clan variable setter. locks everyone out after object construction unless the object is a manticore.
        Parameters:
        clan - a String passed from the FoonLogic class

      • getMonsterType

        public java.lang.String getMonsterType()
        String monster type getter
        Returns:

        String monster type setter, locks everyone out after object construction
        Parameters:
        monsterType - String passed from the object on creation to denote what it is

      • raiseFerocity

        public void raiseFerocity()
        method to raise ferocity value by 1, as long as the object is alive and has less than 20 ferocity presently

        method to lower ferocity value by 1, as long as the object is alive and has more than 0 ferocity presently

      • addTreasure

        public void addTreasure()
        method to raise treasure amount by 1, following a victory in combat and so long as the object is alive.

      • loseTreasure

        public void loseTreasure()
        method to lower the treasure amount by 1, following a loss in combat, currently doesn't matter if object is alive or dead

      • raiseHealth

        public void raiseHealth(int heal)
        method to heal the object following a successful battle cry from an Orc Warlord object
        Parameters:
        heal - healing value passed from an Orc Warlord object

      • lowerHealth

        public void lowerHealth(double damage)
        method to apply damage to an object following a loss in combat. uses Math.floor in order to truncate the health value to 2 decimal places. also checks and updates the life flag after damage is applied.
        Parameters:
        damage - amount of damage inflicted on the object in combat

      • setHealth

        public void setHealth(int health)
        integer health value setter, locks out everyone after object construction
        Parameters:
        health - integer value passed from object's class constructor

      • getAttackScore

        public double getAttackScore()
        method to return an object's attack score as a value of the average of all 3 of the object's attributes. Math.floor used to truncate the value to 2 decimal places.
        Returns:
        double value representing attack score or a 0 if dead

      • getDefenseScore

        public double getDefenseScore()
        method to return an objects defense score as a value of the average of all 3 of the objects attributes. Math.floor used to truncate the value to 2 decimal places. required with the getAttackScore() method as Manticore and OrcWarlord classes override the getAttackScore() method when attacking but uses normal values when defending.
        Returns:
        double value representing defense score or a 0 if dead

      • lifeCheck

        public boolean lifeCheck()
        boolean life flag getter
        Returns:
        boolean lifeFlag to show if object is alive or dead

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overriden toString to display all the stored variables for the object
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String created by concatenating all necessary variables
